001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
004import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
005import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
006import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008
009
010/**
011 * This class represents the 2D geometric transformation for an image taken with some camera A to an image taken with
012 * another camera B.
013 *
014 * @author W. Burger
015 * @version 2016-06-01
016 */
017public class InterCameraMapping implements Mapping2D {
018
019        private final Camera camA, camB;
020        private final RealMatrix Abi;    // inverse of the intrinsic camera b matrix (2 x 3)
021
022        public InterCameraMapping(Camera camA, Camera camB) {
023//              this.isInverseFlag = true;      // maps target -> source
024                this.camA = camA;        // camera A (used to produce the source image)
025                this.camB = camB;        // camera B (determines the geometry the target image)
026                this.Abi = camB.getInverseA();
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d uv) {
031                // (u,v) is an observed sensor point
032                // apply the inverse camera mapping to get the distorted (x,y) point:
033                double[] xy = Abi.operate(MathUtil.toHomogeneous(uv.toDoubleArray()));
034
035                // remove the lens distortion of camera b:
036                double[] xyu = camB.unwarp(xy);
037
038                // apply the lens distortion of camera a:
039                double[] xyd = camA.warp(xyu);
040
041                // apply the (forward) camera mapping to get the undistorted sensor point (u',v'):
042                return PntDouble.from(camA.mapToSensorPlane(xyd));
043        }
044
045}
